alert.note: Alert for North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County; Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued May 09 at 7:29PM MDT until May 11 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...DANGEROUS FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS FADING THIS EVENING BUT WILL RETURN ON TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY... .Critical fire weather conditions will continue in Lincoln county through 9 PM this evening. On Tuesday dangerous conditions will return to South Park, and areas southwest through southeast of Denver. On Wednesday the hot, dry, and windy conditions will be even more widespread, affecting all of the plains and the foothills and mountain valleys as well. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 246 AND 247...EASTERN ELBERT AND LINCOLN COUNTIES... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 9 PM MDT TUESDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY... The National Weather Service in Denver has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect until 9 PM MDT this evening. * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zones 246 and 247. * Timing...Red Flag Warning in effect until 9 PM MDT today and again from 11 AM to 9 PM Tuesday. A Fire Weather Watch is in effect for Wednesday. * Winds...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 40 mph this evening. Similar winds from the south or southeast Tuesday and Wednesday. * Relative Humidity...As low as 8 percent. * Impacts...Any fire that starts will have the potential to spread rapidly. Avoid burning or any outdoor activity that may produce a spark and start a wildfire.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County; Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County
